supersolids.helper.functions¶

Functions for Potential and initial wave function \(\psi_0\)

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

Resolution

Specifies the resolution of the simulation in x, y, z directions (1D, 2D, 3D).

Box

Specifies the ranges in which the simulation is calculated (1D, 2D or 3D).

class supersolids.helper.functions.Resolution(x: float, y: Optional[float] = None, z: Optional[float] = None)[source]¶

Specifies the resolution of the simulation in x, y, z directions (1D, 2D, 3D).

__str__(self) → List[Optional[float]][source]¶

Return str(self).

class supersolids.helper.functions.Box(x0: float, x1: float, y0: Optional[float] = None, y1: Optional[float] = None, z0: Optional[float] = None, z1: Optional[float] = None)[source]¶

Specifies the ranges in which the simulation is calculated (1D, 2D or 3D). Needs to be given in pairs (x0, x1), (y0, y1), (z0, z1).

__str__(self) → List[Optional[float]][source]¶

Return str(self).

lengths(self) → List[float][source]¶

Calculates the box lengths in the directions available in order [x, y, z]

Returns

List of the box length in the directions available in order [x, y, z]

supersolids.helper.functions.psi_gauss_2d_pdf(pos, mu=np.array([0.0, 0.0]), var=np.array([[1.0, 0.0], [0.0, 1.0]]))[source]¶

Gives values according to gaus dirstribution (2D) with meshgrid of x,y as input

Parameters

  • pos – stacked meshgrid of an x (1D) and y (1D)

  • mu – Mean of gauss

  • var – Variance of gauss

  • z_mesh – values according to gaus dirstribution (2D) with meshgrid of x,y as input

supersolids.helper.functions.psi_gauss_2d(x, y, a: float = 1.0, x_0: float = 0.0, y_0: float = 0.0, k_0: float = 0.0)[source]¶

Gaussian wave packet of width a and momentum k_0, centered at x_0

Parameters

  • x – mathematical variable

  • y – mathematical variable

  • a – Amplitude of pulse

  • x_0 – Mean spatial x of pulse

  • y_0 – Mean spatial y of pulse

  • k_0 – Group velocity of pulse

supersolids.helper.functions.psi_gauss_3d(x, y, z, a_x: float = 1.0, a_y: float = 1.0, a_z: float = 1.0, x_0: float = 0.0, y_0: float = 0.0, z_0: float = 0.0, k_0: float = 0.0)[source]¶

Gaussian wave packet of width a and momentum k_0, centered at x_0

Parameters

  • x – mathematical variable

  • y – mathematical variable

  • z – mathematical variable

  • a_x – Stretching factor in x direction

  • a_y – Stretching factor in y direction

  • a_z – Stretching factor in z direction

  • x_0 – Mean spatial x of pulse

  • y_0 – Mean spatial y of pulse

  • z_0 – Mean spatial z of pulse

  • k_0 – Group velocity of pulse

Parameters

  • x – mathematical variable

  • a – Amplitude of pulse

  • x_0 – Mean spatial x of pulse

  • k_0 – Group velocity of pulse

supersolids.helper.functions.psi_pdf(x, loc: float = 0.0, scale: float = 1.0)[source]¶

Mathematical function of gauss pulse

Parameters

  • x – mathematical variable

  • loc – Localization of pulse centre

  • scale – Scale of pulse

supersolids.helper.functions.psi_rect(x, x_min: float = - 0.5, x_max: float = 0.5, a: float = 1.0)[source]¶

Mathematical function of rectangular pulse between x_min and x_max with amplitude a

Parameters

  • x – mathematical variable

  • x_min – Minimum x value of pulse (spatial)

  • x_max – Maximum x value of pulse (spatial)

  • a – Amplitude of pulse

supersolids.helper.functions.camera_func_r(frame: int, r_0: float = 10.0, phi_0: float = 45.0, z_0: float = 20.0, r_per_frame: float = 10.0) → float[source]¶
supersolids.helper.functions.camera_func_phi(frame: int, r_0: float = 10.0, phi_0: float = 45.0, z_0: float = 20.0, phi_per_frame: float = 10.0) → float[source]¶
supersolids.helper.functions.camera_func_z(frame: int, r_0: float = 10.0, phi_0: float = 45.0, z_0: float = 20.0, z_per_frame: float = 10.0) → float[source]¶
supersolids.helper.functions.camera_3d_trajectory(frame: int, r_func: Callable = None, phi_func: Callable = None, z_func: Callable = None, r_0: float = 10.0, phi_0: float = 45.0, z_0: float = 20.0) → Tuple[float, float, float][source]¶

Computes r, phi, z as the components of the camera position in the animation for the given frame. Depending on, if a callable function is given for the components, it is applied to the parameters or the start values are used.

Parameters

  • frame – Index of the frame in the animation

  • r_func – r component of the movement of the camera.

  • phi_func – phi component of the movement of the camera.

  • z_func – z component of the movement of the camera.

  • r_0 – r component of the starting point of the camera movement.

  • phi_0 – phi component of the starting point of the camera movement.

  • z_0 – z component of the starting point of the camera movement.

Returns

r, phi, z as the components of the camera position in the animation for the given frame.

supersolids.helper.functions.noise_mesh(min: float = 0.8, max: float = 1.2, shape: Tuple[int, int, int] = (64, 64, 64)) → numpy.ndarray[source]¶
supersolids.helper.functions.dt_adaptive(t, dt) → float[source]¶
